meanings.definition: Concentrated or thorough in effort or degree.
meanings.sent1: She took an intensive course to improve her English skills.
meanings.sent2: The intensive training program helped him become a better athlete.
meanings.sent3: The intensive cleaning of the house left it sparkling and fresh.
meanings.sent4: His intensive focus on the project paid off with excellent results.
meanings.sent5: The intensive care unit provided round-the-clock attention to the patients.

meanings.definition: Involving or requiring a large amount of something.
meanings.sent1: The intensive rainfall caused flooding in the area.
meanings.sent2: The intensive use of resources led to depletion of natural reserves.
meanings.sent3: The intensive baking session resulted in a delicious array of cookies.
meanings.sent4: The intensive traffic jam delayed everyone's arrival at the event.
meanings.sent5: The intensive farming practices exhausted the soil over time.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a course of study that is more advanced or in-depth than usual.
meanings.sent1: She enrolled in an intensive language program to learn Mandarin quickly.
meanings.sent2: The intensive research project required months of dedicated work.
meanings.sent3: The intensive math class challenged students to think critically.
meanings.sent4: His intensive study habits helped him ace the difficult exam.
meanings.sent5: The intensive workshop provided valuable insights into the subject matter.
